alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 2:21AM PST until February 26 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation, with mostly snow above 1000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Coast Range of Western Oregon. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Elevations below 1000 feet can generally expect slushy accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. There may also be a brief period of freezing rain in the Coast Range valleys this morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon
